intro: Campuloclinium eiteniorum, commonly known as the Eiten's campuloclinium, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
